title: Quasit

|   | A cowardly little demon with a long, viciously pointed tail. Its sharp claws are coated with a venom that stiffens muscles.***“You’ll have to pay double reckoning; ’tis only fair you should pay for your dexterity.” -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, \_Egmont\_, I, 1. 1788. trans. Anna Swanwick, 1914. |

## Useful Info

**Quasits** are fast and annoying [tier-5 demons](/Tier-5_demon "Tier-5 demon") whose attacks drain your [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity"). They've got high [evasion](/Ev "Ev") and a wide variety of resistances, making it difficult for low-level characters to defeat them without taking some stat damage. They are one of the few [demons](/Demon "Demon") you can encounter naturally in the upper floors of the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon").

## Tips & Tricks

- While their Dexterity-draining attacks can be annoying, they are very rarely dangerous. You'll just be a little worse at [dodging](/EV "EV") and [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") for a while.
- [Searing Ray](/Searing_Ray "Searing Ray") and [Iskenderun's Mystic Blast](/Iskenderun%27s_Mystic_Blast "Iskenderun's Mystic Blast") ignore resistances, so they're perfect for the quasit, and even [Magic Dart](/Magic_Dart "Magic Dart") is an option if you don't mind taking a while killing them. [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic") like [Stone Arrow](/Stone_Arrow "Stone Arrow") or [Sandblast](/Sandblast "Sandblast") can also work. If you only have [fire](/Fire "Fire") or [cold](/Cold "Cold") damage at your disposal, use the biggest spells you've got; their resistances aren't insurmountable.
- Quasits have low [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower"), which makes them good targets for [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") or wands of [paralysis](/Wand_of_paralysis "Wand of paralysis") and [disintegration](/Wand_of_disintegration "Wand of disintegration").
html:
Quasit

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.26: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
quasit 5 
HP 9-20
HD 3
XP 45
Speed 13
AC 5
EV 17
Will 10
Attack1 3 (bite: drain dexterity)
Attack2 2 (claw: drain dexterity)
Attack3 2 (claw: drain dexterity)
Resistances rF+
rC+
rPois+
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Demonic
Size Small
Type quasit, quasit
Flags
A cowardly little demon with a long, viciously pointed tail. Its sharp claws are coated with a venom that stiffens muscles.

“You’ll have to pay double reckoning; ’tis only fair you should pay for your dexterity.”
-Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, _Egmont_, I, 1. 1788.
trans. Anna Swanwick, 1914.

Useful Info

Quasits are fast and annoying tier-5 demons whose attacks drain your dexterity. They've got high evasion and a wide variety of resistances, making it difficult for low-level characters to defeat them without taking some stat damage. They are one of the few demons you can encounter naturally in the upper floors of the Dungeon.

Tips & Tricks

  • While their Dexterity-draining attacks can be annoying, they are very rarely dangerous. You'll just be a little worse at dodging and stealth for a while.
  • Searing Ray and Iskenderun's Mystic Blast ignore resistances, so they're perfect for the quasit, and even Magic Dart is an option if you don't mind taking a while killing them. Earth Magic like Stone Arrow or Sandblast can also work. If you only have fire or cold damage at your disposal, use the biggest spells you've got; their resistances aren't insurmountable.
  • Quasits have low willpower, which makes them good targets for Hexes or wands of paralysis and disintegration.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Quasit&oldid=54540"

{{version026}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Quasits''' are fast and annoying [[tier-5 demon]]s whose attacks drain your [[dexterity]]. They've got high [[ev]]asion and a wide variety of resistances, making it difficult for low-level characters to defeat them without taking some stat damage. They are one of the few [[demon]]s you can encounter naturally in the upper floors of the [[Dungeon]].

==Tips & Tricks==
*While their Dexterity-draining attacks can be annoying, they are very rarely dangerous. You'll just be a little worse at [[EV|dodging]] and [[stealth]] for a while.
*[[Searing Ray]] and [[Iskenderun's Mystic Blast]] ignore resistances, so they're perfect for the quasit, and even [[Magic Dart]] is an option if you don't mind taking a while killing them. [[Earth Magic]] like [[Stone Arrow]] or [[Sandblast]] can also work. If you only have [[fire]] or [[cold]] damage at your disposal, use the biggest spells you've got; their resistances aren't insurmountable.
*Quasits have low [[willpower]], which makes them good targets for [[Hexes]] or wands of [[wand of paralysis|paralysis]] and [[wand of disintegration|disintegration]].
